伊朗將鈾氣體注入地下核設施離心機 法俄警戒
07 Nov 2019, 08:04 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, 中央通訊社
（中央社杜拜6日綜合外電報導）伊朗國營電視台與半島電視台報導，伊朗恢復福爾多地下核設施運作，將鈾氣體注入離心機，法國表示，這是首次顯示，德黑蘭當局打算揚棄與世界強權簽署的限縮核子活動核協議。


影片來源：AI Jazeera English Youtube頻道

針對伊朗決定開始把鈾氣體注入福爾多（Fordow）核設施的離心機，進一步遠離核協議，俄羅斯也表達憂慮。這項協議主要目的在於把伊朗打造出核武的時間，從2至3個月拉長至1年。
伊朗國營電視台報導：「在國際原子能總署（International Atomic Energy Agency，IAEA）監察人員在場情況下，伊朗開始將（鈾）氣體注入福爾多核設施的離心機。」
2015年簽署的核協議禁止福爾多從事提煉濃縮鈾作業，但在伊朗將鈾氣體注入離心機後，這項設施將從獲准從事研究計畫工廠，變成運作中核子設施。
然而，伊朗原子能組織（Atomic Energy Organisation of Iran）發言人卡馬萬迪（Behrouz Kamalvandi）隨後告訴國營電視台，將從午夜（2030 GMT，台灣時間7日凌晨4時30分）開始注入鈾氣體。
卡馬萬迪表示：「我們已經把2800公斤圓筒置於福爾多，其中包括2000公斤六氟化鈾氣體…那些離心機將提煉純度達4.5%的濃縮鈾。」
當年曾共同擘劃核協議的伊朗總統羅哈尼（Hassan Rouhani），把伊朗縮減核協議承諾歸咎於美國，並稱福爾多設施很快就會全面恢復提煉濃縮鈾作業。
羅哈尼發推文表示：「伊朗今天開始向1044台離心機注入氣體，這是伊朗第4度縮減在聯合全面行動方案（JCPOA，2015年核協議）的承諾，那是美國政策及其盟友造成的，福爾多很快就會全面恢復運作。」（譯者：吳昇鴻/核稿：劉學源）1081106

Iran injects uranium gas into underground nuclear facility centrifuge
07 Nov 2019, 08:04 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, Central News Agency
Iran’s state-run television station and Al Jazeera reported that Iran has resumed the operation of the underground nuclear facility in Foldo and injected uranium gas into the centrifuge. France said that this is the first time that the Tehran authorities intend to abandon the power of the world. Signed a nuclear agreement for the reduction of nuclear activities.


Source: AI Jazeera English Youtube Channel

Russia also expressed concern about Iran’s decision to start pumping uranium gas into the centrifuge of the Fordow nuclear facility, further away from the nuclear deal. The main purpose of this agreement is to extend Iran's nuclear weapons from 2 to 3 months to 1 year.
The Iranian state-run television station reported: "In the presence of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) inspectors, Iran began to inject (uranium) gas into the centrifuges of the Ford nuclear facility."
The nuclear agreement signed in 2015 prohibited Fuldo from refining enriched uranium, but after Iran injected uranium gas into the centrifuge, the facility would be allowed to operate as a research facility and become a nuclear facility in operation.
However, the spokesman of the Atomic Energy Organisation of Iran, Behrouz Kamalvandi, told the state-run television station that uranium gas would be injected from midnight (2030 GMT, 4:30 am on the 7th, Taiwan time).
Kamawandi said: "We have placed 2,800 kilograms of cylinders in Foldo, including 2000 kilograms of uranium hexafluoride gas... those centrifuges will extract enriched uranium with a purity of 4.5%."
Iranian President Hassan Rouhani, who had jointly drafted a nuclear agreement, blamed the United States for its nuclear reduction commitments and said that the Fuldo facility would soon resume full-scale enrichment of uranium.
Rohani sent a tweet: "Iran started to inject gas into 1,044 centrifuges today. This is Iran's fourth reduction in the joint comprehensive action plan (JCPOA, 2015 nuclear agreement), which is caused by US policy and its allies. Foldo will soon resume full operation."
